meanings.definition: To surpass in begging for something.
meanings.sent1: The little girl outbegged her brother for the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: She outbegged all her classmates for extra playtime.
meanings.sent3: The puppy outbegged the kitten for attention from their owner.
meanings.sent4: The street performer outbegged the others for tips with his entertaining act.
meanings.sent5: The determined squirrel outbegged the birds for nuts in the park.

meanings.definition: To have begged more successfully than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He outbegged his friend for a higher allowance from their parents.
meanings.sent2: The talented musician outbegged the competition for the top spot in the talent show.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outbegged the hunter for a share of the food left behind.
meanings.sent4: The skilled negotiator outbegged the other party for a better deal.
meanings.sent5: The persistent student outbegged the teacher for an extension on the deadline.
